summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and Dr. Gail Goodman regarding Dr. Goodman's potential role as an expert witness in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails discuss scheduling a call to consult about testifying at the trial beginning November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Gail Goodman
persons.context: Contacted by prosecutors to potentially consult and testify as an expert witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She is coordinating a call time while mentioning a dentist appointment in Napa.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, reaching out to Dr. Gail Goodman to discuss her potential consultation and testimony at the trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, with trial scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.

connections.description: Prosecutor contacting a potential expert witness to consult and possibly testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Dr. Goodman is being considered as an expert witness for the prosecution in the trial against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell trial begins
events.description: The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Prosecutors contact expert witness
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey emails Dr. Gail Goodman to discuss her potential role as an expert witness in the Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were actively seeking expert witnesses just days before the trial was set to begin on November 29, 2021.
Dr. Gail Goodman, a Distinguished Professor, was contacted by Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey for potential consultation and testimony.
The correspondence shows the prosecution's preparation efforts, including scheduling calls across time zones during the holiday weekend.
The document is part of the evidence file (EFTA00076461-62) related to the Maxwell trial.
